original: Holmquist, Jarl Leopold, magistratssekreterare, notarius publicus, Göteborg, f. 8/4/87 i Hjärtum, Gbgs o. Boh. 1., av löjtn. Carl Magnus H. o. Anna Svensson. G. 21 m. Signe Engel’brekts-son. Barn: Lennart f. 22, jur. stud., Upps., Inger 23, anst. v. stadsing :kont., üpps., Arne 26, ing., Hans 29, stud. — Mog:ex. v. Gbgs h. real 06, jur. kand. i Lund II. Tingstjg. 12-13, e. o. not. i Göta hovr. 11, i Svea hovr. 13, i Gbgs rådhusr. 14, tf. magistr :sekr. o. not. publ. där 18, polisnot. 19, andre rådhuskansl. s. å., magistr :sekr. o. not. publ. sed. 20. Aman. h. domkap. i Gbgs stift 16-19, jur. bitr. h. drätsel-kamm. andra avd. ett år, sekr. där två mån., sekr. h. Sjökapt. i Gbg pens:-kassa fr. 16, h. nykterh :ndn 19-26, h. direkt, f. Gbgs sjöm:hu,s fr. 26, ordf. i tax:nd 20-26, led. av styr. f. o. kasisa-föirv. i Gbgs jur:kil. 21-26, huv:man i Fasitdgh :äg. Sparbank fr. 22, led. av styr. fr. 37, ordf. 47, styr:suppl. i Gbgs stads-hyp:fören. fr. 26, led. av styr. fr. 36, ordf. 47, led. av styr. f. Und ::stödls’före;n. f. Gbgs stads befattn:hav. fr. 24, ordf. 26-27, suppl. i styr. f. fören. Sv:es stadsdomare samt sekr. o. kassaför-valt. där 29-34, ord. led. 35-37, fullm:-suppl. i Städ. Allm. Brandstodshol. i Sthlm m. dotterbol. 28, fullm. fr. 38 o. styr:suppl. fr. 40, ord. led. 44, styr:-suppl. i Pens :inrättn. i Gbg fr. 33, av KB förordn. led. av lokalstyr. f. Ma-jornas h. a. 1. i Gbg fr. 33, dito av lok. värder:ndn i Gbg fr. 39, rev. i A-B Gbgs Hand:bank fr. 37, styr:suppl. i Alim. Änke- o. Pens :kassan i Gbg fr. 39, ord. led. 41, suppl. i A-B Gbgssy-stemet. RNO, RVO.
translated:
Holmquist, Jarl Leopold, magistrate secretary, notary public, Gothenburg, born on April 8, 1887 in Hjärtum, Gothenburg and Bohus County, son of Lieutenant Carl Magnus H. and Anna Svensson. Married in 1921 to Signe Engelbrektson. Children: Lennart (born in 1922, law student in Uppsala), Inger (born in 1923, employed at the city's customs office in Uppsala), Arne (born in 1926, engineer), and Hans (born in 1929, student).

He passed his exams at the Gothenburg Higher Real Gymnasium in 1906 and acquired a law degree from Lund University in 1911-1913. He worked as an acting notary at the Gothenburg Court of Appeal in 1911, then at the Svea Court of Appeal in 1913, and at the Gothenburg City Hall in 1914. He served as a temporary magistrate secretary and notary public there in 1918, police notary in 1919, and second town clerk. He was an assistant to the diocesan court in the Gothenburg Diocese from 1916-1919, legal assistant at the second department of the Gothenburg Municipal Council for a year, secretary there for two months, and secretary of the Sea Captain's Pension Fund in Gothenburg from 1916. He was also secretary of the temperance association from 1919-1926, chairman of the tax board from 1920-1926, member of the board of directors for the savings bank in Fässberg from 1921-1926 and chairman from 1922, member of the board of the Gothenburg City Mortgage Association from 1926 and chairman from 1947, member of the board of the Relief and Support Association for Gothenburg's municipal employees from 1924, chairman from 1926-1927, deputy in the board of the Sweden's city judges' association, and secretary and treasurer from 1929-1934. He was an alternate member of the board of directors of the Stockholm General Fire Insurance Company and its subsidiary from 1928, and a member from 1935-1937, deputy in the board of the Gothenburg Pension Institution from 1933, appointed by the National Library, a member of the local board for Major Hans Home from 1933, and of the local valuation committee from 1939. He was a reviewer of the Gothenburg Handelsbanken from 1937, deputy in the board of the Gothenburg Widow and Pension Fund from 1939, member from 1941 and deputy in the board of the Gothenburg System from 1941. He was awarded the Royal Order of the North Star and the Royal Order of Vasa.
